Dear Mackenzie Bentley:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/23/25, a staff member flipped a youth's hat of their head and
asked why they were wearing a dirty cap. The staff member has
been placed on suspension.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on May 13, 2025.
Administrator 1 reported he was made aware of these allegations
and confirmed via video that the allegations had occurred. He
reported when reviewing video, he saw Therapist flip Youth A’s
hat off their head and ask him why he is wearing a dirty cap.
Administrator 1 reported this in appropriate behavior and placed
Therapist on administrative leave immediately.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 14,
2025. Youth A reported he likes living at the facility and gets along
with most staff. He reported one day when Therapist hit his hat off
his head and told him his hat was dirty. Youth A reported this
made him feel embarrassed because it was in a room full of
people. He reported he does not know why Therapist did that to
him. Youth A reported they have a positive relationship, and
sometimes she likes to joke around with him. He reported he felt
that she should not have flipped his hat off his head.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025.
Therapist reported on April 23, 2025, before Youth B’s birthday
party, she had a therapy session with Youth A. She reported
during that session; Youth A had talked about the new hat he had
on. Therapist reported Youth A stated he had received his hat
from storage, and it was dirty because he used to wear it when he
worked in construction. She reported she talked with Youth A
about how he could clean his hat and told him that he shouldn’t
wear the hat until it is clean. Therapist reported when she showed
up to Youth B’s birthday party, she flipped Youth A’s hat off his
head because she had just told him he shouldn’t wear it. She
reported she did this as a joke, not with malicious intent. Therapist
reported Staff 1 had come up to her after the event and told her
that Youth A was offended about her flipping the hat off his head.
2

She reported she talked with Youth A and apologized for making
him feel that way. Therapist reported she was just trying to joke
around with him over the situation. When asked if staff are allowed
to joke or horseplay with the youth, Therapist reported it is a gray
area and noted she does not believe this situation would
constitute horseplay. She reported majority of the training they
receive about the interactions with the youth are about sexual
misconduct, and believes they need more training on day-to-day
interactions with the youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 14,
2025. Youth B reported he likes the facility, and the staff treat him
well. He reported he recently celebrated his birthday there, and
the staff made him feel cared for. Youth B reported at one point
during the party Therapist flipped Youth A’s hat off his head. He
reported he did not know why this occurred, but Youth A was very
upset by this. Youth B reported Youth A turned all red and was
embarrassed. He reported staff are not allowed to horseplay with
the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 14,
2025. Staff 1 reported on April 23, 2025, the facility had a birthday
party for Youth B, and they played some bingo. She reported she
was sitting next to Youth A during the party. Staff 1 reported she
witnessed Therapist walk up behind Youth A and flip his hat off his
head. She reported she then heard Therapist state his hat was
dirty. Staff 1 reported this made Youth A visibly upset as he was
turning red, disengaged from playing the game, and put his head
down. She reported she confronted Therapist about this situation
as she felt that it was not a respectful thing to do. Staff 1 reported
she encouraged Therapist to apologize to Youth A, which she did
do. She reported staff at the facility are trained to treat youth with
respect and should not touch the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 14,
2025. Staff 2 reported she participated in the birthday party for
Youth B on April 23, 2025. She reported she witnessed Therapist
walk up behind Youth A and flip his hat off his head. Staff 2
reported she witnessed Youth A become visually upset after this
happened. She reported she talked with Therapist about this, and
Therapist stated the hat was dirty, that is why she did it. Staff 2
reported she is unaware if Therapist apologized. She reported
Therapist’s behavior is against what they are trained for at the
facility because this was not a respectful thing to do. Staff 2
reported staff are trained to treat the youth with respect.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 14,
2025. Staff 3 reported during Youth B’s birthday party on April 23,
2025, she saw someone flip Youth A’s hat off his head. She
reported she is not for sure who that was, but believed it was
Therapist. Staff 3 reported the situation became a bit awkward, so
she tried to make light of the situation and talked to Youth A about
his hat. She reported there was a comment made about the hat
being dirty and she tried to talk to him about how to clean the hat.
Staff 3 reported Youth A did not want to talk and shut down about
the situation. She reported she believed Therapist was trying to
joke around with Youth A, but he did not take it that way.
Staff 4 and Staff 5 were separately interviewed face to face at
the facility on May 14, 2025. Staff 4 and Staff 5 confirmed they
were at Youth B’s birthday party on April 23, 2025. Both reported
they did not witness anything inappropriate happening at the
party. Staff 4 reported herself and Staff 5 were busy making sure
everything was set up for the party. Both confirmed they are
trained to treat the youth respect and to not horse play.
Video Recording
Video record of April 23, 2025 was reviewed by this
consultant on May 14, 2025- The video recording is within the
recreation area room. Youth A is sitting at the head of the table
and is wearing a baseball hat with the hat bill towards the back.
Therapist walked up behind Youth A and flipped Youth A’s head
off his head. Within the video it is seen Therapist flips the hat from
the back to the front of Youth A’s head. Youth A puts his hat back
on and puts his head down. Therapist took a seat at the end of the
table. Youth B, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 were all
present in the room.
Documents Reviewed:
- Therapist Human Resource File- Therapist has no
disciplinary actions noted within her human resource file.
Therapist is up to date on all required trainings, including
the code of conduct training on February 4, 2025. A signed
copy of understanding the code of conduct was signed by
Therapist on February 4, 2025.
- Facility’s Employee Handbook dated May 10, 2025-
Within this document it notes that the standard of conduct
of staff is to conduct themselves in a polite and professional
manner while performing their work duties any time they
are on the property. Staff must demonstrate respect and
4

kindness toward other staff, youth, and other they interact
with while performing their job duties.
- Facility Incident report dated May 8, 2025, completed
by Administrator 1- The incident reported noted on
05/08/2025 there was disclosure from Staff 1 and Staff 2
that Therapist had made Youth A feel uncomfortable when
she flipped a hat off of his head on 04/23/2025.
Administrator 1 had reviewed video footage of this situation
and informed state licensing.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of Therapist following the
internal policy of the facility’s code of conduct. The facility’s code
of conduct notes staff are to conduct themselves in a polite and
professional manner and should demonstrate respect and
kindness towards the youth. Within the video, Therapist does
come up behind Youth A and flips his hat off his head. Within
interviews, Youth A reported feeling embarrassed of Therapist
flipping his hat staff off his head.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
